author: mikemaccana
body: Heya! Powershell 6 is `pwsh`. But folks in the Powershell community have called it `posh` for more than a decade now. It would be cool for the command to do the same.

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: @mikemaccana  What do you mean by CALL here ? are you referring to the executable name(pwsh.exe) ?

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body: @kvprasoon Yep, call as in 'name by which you call it'. It should be `posh` because: - it's posh.

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: There are reasons why we didn't(were not able to) use `posh`. See [this](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4214 ).

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @mikemaccana within the Community, people call it `posh` and as far as I'm concerned `pwsh` is pronounced `posh`.  However, as @kvprasoon pointed out, we've been through this discussion and we couldn't use `posh` literally as it's an existing shell

title: Request: call it `posh` rather than `pwsh`
